p: According to the WHO data, a total of 8442 cases of clinically diagnosed SARS were reported worldwide, with 919 deaths and 32 countries and regions affected. Most of the cases occurred in China, Canada and Singapore. Both outbreaks were first reported in China and resulted in a large number of infections. However, the COVID-19 has been more widespread and has spread faster than SARS, affecting populations around the globe [ 4].
